definition[0]: the system by which people illegally buy and sell foreign money, goods that are difficult to obtain etc
example[0]: Many foods were only available on the black market.
example[2]: There was a thriving black market in foreign currency.
definition[1]: the illegal buying and selling of goods that are usually impossible to get in a particular city or country
example[3]: A pack of foreign cigarettes on the black market goes for the equivalent of at least $17.
definition[2]: the buying of foreign currency at an unofficial rate
example[4]: The official exchange rate is about 5.6 kyat to the dollar, or more than 10 times its current value on the black market.
